name: Annual Budget Process
description: Lead the annual budgeting cycle from kickoff through Board approval. Includes setting guidelines, collecting departmental inputs, consolidating into enterprise budget, running scenarios, and preparing final presentations.

currentProcess.description: Create templates and distribute to departments
Collect department submissions and follow up
Run multiple iteration cycles with departments

painPoints: Time pressure at end of process

currentProcess.description: Create Board presentation and supporting materials

aiProcess.toolRationale: Claude can structure comprehensive guidelines based on strategic priorities
aiProcess.expectedOutput: Draft guidelines document with calendar and instructions
tips: Provide strategic priorities and high-level targets
Include any specific constraints or assumptions

aiProcess.expectedOutput: Customized templates for each department type
tips: Include prior year actuals as starting point
Add clear instructions within the template

aiProcess.toolRationale: Human coordination needed; AI helps draft follow-up emails
Gemini handles data consolidation and flags inconsistencies
aiProcess.expectedOutput: Consolidated budget with flagged items for review
tips: Ask for summary by department and category

aiProcess.description: Analyze gaps and generate reduction options
aiProcess.toolRationale: Claude can reason about trade-offs and prioritization
aiProcess.expectedOutput: Gap analysis with prioritized reduction options
tips: Provide strategic priorities to guide cuts
Ask for impact assessment of each option

aiProcess.toolRationale: Human negotiation; AI helps with documentation and talking points
Claude can identify key sensitivities and build consistent scenarios
aiProcess.expectedOutput: Base, upside, downside scenarios with sensitivity tables
tips: Ensure scenarios tell a coherent story

aiProcess.expectedOutput: Draft Board presentation outline and key messages
tips: Focus on strategic story, not just numbers

aiProcess.toolRationale: Manual approvals; AI helps with documentation

whyItMatters: The annual budget is the financial expression of strategy. It determines resource allocation, sets performance expectations, and drives accountability across the organization. A well-run budget process builds credibility with the Board and sets teams up for success.
commonMistakes: Starting too late - budget season always takes longer than expected
Unclear guidelines leading to inconsistent submissions
Letting departments set their own targets (budget should cascade from strategic goals)
Over-indexing on precision - directional accuracy matters more than false precision
Not building in contingency for the unexpected
tips: Use AI to draft the initial guidelines - gets you to 80% faster
Create a 'budget FAQ' using AI based on common questions from prior years
Ask AI to role-play as a skeptical Board member - identify weak points in your story
Build a 'reduction options library' that carries forward year to year
sources: Gartner FP&A Research - Planning cycle studies
